author: psiwebtn
title: Good day for PV
text:
Good day for PV Saturday, October 3, 2015 
Pleasant Valley was a perfect 3-0 on Friday night. The volleyball team and both soccer teams earned victories. 
BOYS SOCCER 
Northern Lehigh came up short against Bangor in Colonial League competition, 1-0. 
N’western-Salisbury 
Northwestern scored three goals in the second half to defeat Salisbury in a Colonial League contest, 4-0. 
Haley Dietrich scored twice, as Courtney Page and Leighanna Lister chipped in a goals. 
PMW-Pleasant Valley 
Pleasant Valley topped Pocono Mountain west in an Eastern Pennsylvania Conference contest at home, 4-0. 
Devon Woltal, Jacob Clifford, Malichai Jones, and Logan Mackes each scored for the Bears. 
VOLLEYBALL 
Pleasant Valley defeated East Stroudsburg North in an Eastern Pennsylvania Conference match, 25-20, 25-7, 25-17. 
Alexis Richey led the Lady Bears with 15 assists and 4 aces. 
Noel Kelly contributed seven kills, five digs, and three aces. 
GIRLS SOCCER 
PMW-Pleasant Valley 
Pleasant Valley shutout Eastern Pennsylvania Conference foe Pocono Mountain West, 4-0. 
Erin Sharpe, Maggie Leach, and Abby Leach all scored goals for the Lady Bears during the win. 
Blue Mtn.-Tamaqua 
Blue Mountain convincingly defeated Tamaqua in Schuylkill League competition, 8-1. 
Lynn Kistler scored Tamaqua’s lone goal in the contest. 
CROSS COUNTRY 
Paul Short Invit. 
Tamaqua had a busy afternoon on Friday in the Paul Short Invitational. 
Tamaqua’s Brad Clemson was the Raiders’ best finish on the boys side, in 142nd place. His teammate Raymond Kinder placed 180th. There were 375 competitors on the boys side. 
As for the girls, Tamaqua’s Sarah Mue finished in 27th place. Kailee Carroll wasn’t far behind in 36th place. The girls competition featured 322 runners. 
FOOTBALL 
MIDDLE SCHOOL 
Lehighton-N. Schuyl. 
Lehighton (2-1) lost to North Schuykill, 52-18 for their first loss of the season. Isaiah Wetzel had two kickoff returns of 80 and 75 yards for touchdowns. Ethan Lutz caught a three-yard touchdown pass. 
Lehighton-Blue Mtn. 
Lehighton (2-2) dropped its second game in a row to Blue Mountain, 32 -13. Lucas Sangiuliano scored on a four-yard run and threw a 54-yard touchdown pass to Devon Haydt. Haydt also kicked an extra point. Brett Gasker had an interception for the Indians.
